name: Stirge
lore: Stirges are bat-like blood-drinking pests with long, needle-like proboscises. They lurk in dark places and descend in swarms to latch onto warm-blooded creatures, draining their blood until sated or slain. Though individually feeble, a swarm of stirges can bleed even a hardy adventurer dry.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) Hit Points from blood loss. The stirge can detach itself as a Bonus Action. It does so after it drains 10 Hit Points of blood or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can take an action to detach the stirge.
